intro: Coccoloba rubiginosa, commonly known as the scarlet ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, often covered in a whitish, powdery coating called bloom. Its small, pinkish-white flowers are followed by bright red berries that attract birds. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging coastal environments.
